name: TheAtlantic
text: Saint John the Apostle wrote that "perfect love drives out fear," and neurobiological evidence suggests that's true. For "How to Build a Life," @arthurbrooks argues that when we feel afraid, the answer is to seek out love. https://t.co/K1oYZhuq8X

name: TheAtlantic
text: The grim effects of Trump’s wayward whims have turned Americans into a nation of armchair psychologists, struggling to understand the workings of one particular psyche, @megangarber writes: https://t.co/4UUZ1OY9c4

name: TheAtlantic
text: Laura Ingraham’s dark pessimism, with its echoes of the most radical left- and right-wing movements in American political history, helps explain how she became, long before many others, a convinced supporter of Donald Trump. @anneapplebaum reports: https://t.co/AozlxJivEf

name: TheAtlantic
text: 75 years ago, the first nuclear bomb was detonated in the New Mexico desert. @ibogost revisits the desolate memorial to the moment that ignited America’s future: https://t.co/nexHTZdS1n
